body.title: Accommodation in Cinque Terre
body.subtitle: From beachfront hotels to cliffside guesthouses, find your ideal home base for exploring Italy's most beautiful coastal villages. Book early - availability is limited in these tiny UNESCO gems.

body.title: Where Should You Stay?
body.subtitle: Each village offers a unique experience.

features.title: Monterosso
features.description: Best for families and beach lovers. Most hotels, easiest access, sandy beach. The most 'resort-like' village with the widest accommodation selection.

features.title: Vernazza
features.description: Most picturesque. Limited rooms but unforgettable harbor views. Book months ahead for rooms overlooking the iconic harbor.

features.title: Corniglia
features.description: Quietest and most authentic. Fewer tourists, vineyard views, but 382 steps from the train. Best for travelers seeking tranquility.

features.title: Manarola
features.description: Most romantic. Spectacular sunset views, wine culture, cliffside rooms. Very limited options - book 4-6 months ahead.

features.title: Riomaggiore
features.description: Best for hikers and nightlife. Excellent restaurants, vibrant evening scene, good trail access. Most options after Monterosso.

features.title: Stay Outside?
features.description: La Spezia offers more availability and lower prices. 10-minute train to villages. Good option if Cinque Terre is fully booked.

body.title: Securing Your Perfect Stay
body.subtitle: Insider advice for booking in Cinque Terre
body.content: **Book early** - 3-6 months ahead for summer, earlier for specific rooms. **Direct booking** sometimes offers better rates than platforms. **Minimum stays** are common (2-3 nights in peak season). **Sea views** cost 30-50% more but are worth it. **Stairs are inevitable** - most rooms involve climbs. **No cars** means carrying luggage on foot - pack light!

items.question: How far in advance should I book?
items.answer: 3-6 months for summer (June-August). 1-2 months for shoulder season (April-May, Sept-Oct). Last-minute possible in winter.

items.question: What are typical prices?
items.answer: Budget rooms €80-120, mid-range €120-200, sea-view rooms €200-350+. Prices peak July-August. Monterosso and Manarola tend to be priciest.

items.question: Hotels or apartments?
items.answer: Hotels offer breakfast and services. Apartments give more space and kitchen access - great for longer stays. B&Bs offer authentic local hospitality.

items.question: Can I park my car?
items.answer: Only Monterosso and Riomaggiore have parking (€20-30/day). Most visitors arrive by train. If driving, park in La Spezia instead.

items.question: Is there air conditioning?
items.answer: Not always - historic buildings often lack AC. Ask when booking for summer stays. Sea breezes help, but August can be hot.

items.question: What about luggage?
items.answer: You'll carry bags through narrow streets and up stairs. Most places don't have elevators. Pack light or use luggage transfer services.
